1020/A0/05/001/001.status_value: In 2015 the dropout rate in secondary was 9.2%  male: 10.2%  female: 8.1%  urban: 9.0% and rural: 9.8%. Regions: Grande de Térraba (17.7%)  Aguirre (17.6%)  Coto (15.6%) y Sarapiquí (14.6%). In 2015  the dropout rates in primary was 1.3%   Male:1.5%  Famale: 1.3 %. Urban: 1.2% and Rural: 1.7%. Regions: Limón (3.4%)  Sulá (3.2%)  Peninsular (1.9%) y Guápiles (2.2%). Source Verification: Statistics from the Ministry of Education (MEP).
1020/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.1.1.1: Primary and secondary school dropout rates in areas of greatest social exclusion  disaggregated by gender  region and area (urban/rural).
1020/A0/05/001/001.headline: Facilitated access to best practices for reducing school exclusion.
1020/A0/05/001/001.baseline_value: Total: 10 2%  Male: 11.6%  Female: 8.9% (MEP  2010)  Urban Areas 9.2%  Rural: 12.1%.

1020/A0/05/001/001.status_value: In 2015  98.7% first grade completation percentage  Male: 98.5% and Famale: 98.9%. Urban: 95.8% and Rural 95.1%. Regions: Heredia (Aguirre 99.7%)  Cañas (98.9%) and Desamparados (97.5%). In 2015  70.0% seventh grade completation percentage  Male: 67.4% and Female: 73.1%. Urban: 72.5% and Rural: 78.9%. Regions: Desamparados (62.8%)  Cartago (66.6%) and San José Central (70.0%). Source Verification: Statistics from the Ministry of Public Education (MEP)

1020/A0/05/001/001.headline: Facilitated access to best practices for reducing school exclusion.

1020/A0/04/005/007.indicator_name: Adequate human resources (staff and consultants) for program component implementation
1020/A0/04/005/007.baseline_value: Basic human resources to initiate programme component in 2008

1020/A0/04/004/001.status_value: Information on coverage of comprehensive care services by canton and district available in 2012  via the 2011 Census.
1020/A0/04/004/001.indicator_name: % of children under 5 years who are not benefiting from comprehensive care services mapped

1020/A0/04/004/001.status_value: In 2012  a specialized study on salt iodization developed. Six (6) institutional manuals and/or guides completed (Eyesight monitoring  hearing monitoring  nutritional status monitoring  simplified scale for Evaluation of Comprehensive Development of Children Age 0-6  Institutional Guide for the Operation of Care Centers  Guide for Child Development in the Municipality of Desamparados  and a operating model for nutritional monitoring surveillance systems.
1020/A0/04/004/001.indicator_name: By 2012  national capacity strengthen to provide quality comprehensive care for children  with an emphasis on early childhood within districts with high poverty and low social development indicators
1020/A0/04/004/001.baseline_value: No studies for quality improvement of care services in 2008

1020/A0/05/002/001.status_value: 28/32 municipal plans that incorporate strategies and social programs to address inequities /disparities for children.
1020/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.2.1.1: Number municipal plans that incorporate strategies and social programs to address inequities /disparities for children.
1020/A0/05/002/001.headline: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence.
1020/A0/05/002/001.baseline_value: 3 municipal plans (Source: Municipal capacity strengthening program  Institute for Municipal Development and Assistance (IFAM) and the Ministry of Decentralization and Local Development.)

1020/A0/05/002/001.status_value: The main advance was the agreement of the CNNA in the constitution of a unit for the inter-institutional and inter-sectoral coordination in the elimination of violence against children and adolescents  it was agreed that this unit worked in PANI. It is currently defining its operating structure and its main strategies for action over the next two years (2016-2021).
1020/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.2.1.2: National Plan for the Prevention of Violence against Children and Adolescents implemented.
1020/A0/05/002/001.headline: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence.

1020/A0/05/002/001.status_value: In 2016 the strategy for the prevention of violence was promoted in 4 communities: Guararí of the canton of Heredia  Guápiles of the canton of Pococí  La Capri of the canton of Desamparados and the dikes of the canton of Cartago that have high levels of violence and that form Part of the strategy of civic centers for peace promoted by the Ministry of Justice.
1020/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.2.1.3: Articulation and implementation of a strategy for the prevention of violence against children and adolescents generating behavior and practice changes within schools  families and the communities.
1020/A0/05/002/001.headline: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence.

1020/A0/05/002/001.status_value: Advocacy strategy formulated in 20 cantons vulnerable and replicating in 36 cantons.
1020/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.2.1.4: An advocacy and social mobilization strategy for the fight against violence against children  adolescents and women.
1020/A0/05/002/001.headline: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence.

1020/A0/05/002/001.status_value: 27 cantons the Local Governments have identified and promoved cultural and sports activities.  We will continue promouting this stretegy of prevention violence fort the next year.
1020/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.2.1.5: Sports and cultural programs to prevent violence  which are coordinated by national or local government  are available to children and adolescents.
1020/A0/05/002/001.headline: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence.
1020/A0/05/002/001.baseline_value: The strategy for the promotion and implementation of social programs for children elaborated in 1st semester of 2013.

1020/A0/05/002/001.status_value: During 2016 and 2017  UNICEF is supporting MIDEPLAN in the development of the new IBINA.
1020/A0/05/002/001.indicator_name: Indicator 1.2.1.6: Children's Vulnerability Index by canton / region updated periodically.
1020/A0/05/002/001.headline: Cantons with improved welfare indicators have improved protection services against different forms of violence.
